result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey S Wiersma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Casey S Wiersma is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Casey S Wiersma was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If no issues after one year, court will allow the probation to terminate.  (Defendant will need to apply for early termination).

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casey S Wiersma

records.addlTxt: of Conviction (DOC-37) - early termination effective 12/06/2017

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
9:44 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Preston Smead.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Smead confirms receipt of the criminal complaint on 2016CM303 and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Statement by Atty Smead regarding probable cause.  Statement by ADA - moves to amend the PC to misdemeanor.  Court allows the amendment of the PC to say misdemeanor.  Court finds probable cause.  ADA recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 on 2016CM303 and count 1 on 2016CF24 amended to misdemeanor Disorderly Conduct with probation, and the balance of the counts will be dismissed.  Court questions ADA regarding victim.  Statement by ADA - has not been able to get in touch with the victim, has left numerous messages.  Atty Smead concurs with the agreement.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 of the amended charge of Disorderly Conduct on 2016CF24 and orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed outright.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged on 2016CM303.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Smead.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CF24 (Count 1) and 2016CM303 (Count 1)

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 2 years, if no issues after one year, court will allow the probation to terminate.  (Defendant will need to apply for early termination).

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-DNA Sample.

-2016CM303 - Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Court adjourned at 9:57 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.

1:35 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Preston Smead.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Smead - have an agreement in this matter but involves a case that is not filed yet.  Statement by ADA - should be filed within the next couple of days.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on December 6, 2016 at 9:30 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 1:36 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

3:01 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Preston Smead.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Smead - was provided some additional discovery at the last hearing and requests some time to submit a formal offer to the state.  ADA concurs.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on  November 29, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 3:02 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

2:30 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Preston Smead.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Smead - are in active plea negotiations and would like to discuss with the defendant.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on October 18, 2016 at 2:30 P.M.  

Court adjourned at 2:32 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

2:18 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Preston Smead.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Smead - matter is not resolved and parties are in active negotiations and requests another court date.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on Augsut 30, 2016 at 2:00 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 2:19 p.m.
Proposed
State's
Scheduling Order

12:03 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Preston Smead.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Smead - not settled and requests a jury trial to be scheduled.  Court sets for Status Hearing on July 19, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.  Court orders all motions and witness lists be filed by July 18, 2016.

Court adjourned at 12:03 p.m.
State's
Status hearing on June 7, 2016 at 11:30 am.

11:03 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Preston Smead.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Smead - prelimin will proceed.

Josh Ward sworn, direct by ADA Vanden Branden - is employed as detective for Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Goes over training and qualifications.  Venue established.  Identified the defendant present in court.
Cross exam by Atty Smead.

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial.  ADA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to counsel.  Atty Smead confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Atty Smead enters a plea of Not Guilty.  Court sets for Status Hearing on June 7, 2016 at 11:00 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 11:15 a.m.
Preliminary hearing on May 10, 2016 at 11:00 am.

11:33 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Preston Smead present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Smead - need to schedule a preliminary hearing.  Court sets for Preliminary Hearing on May 10, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:34 a.m.
By Atty Preston Smead
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Status hearing on April 12, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

8:37 A.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Preston Smead.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Smead confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for April 12, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:40 a.m.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
